publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Salomons pest-house, or tovvre-royall : Nevvly re-edified and prepared to preserue Londoners with their families, and others, from the doubted deluge of the plague. Item, a laudable exercise for those that are departed, or shall depart out of the city into the country, to spend their time till they returne. A handfull of holy meditations vsefull and requisite for Gods people ... By the reuerend, learned, and godly diuine I.D. preacher of Gods word. Whereunto is added Mr Hollands admonition, and Mr Phaers prescription for bodily physicke. Also, London looke-backe: a description or representation of the great and memorable mortality an. 1625. in heroicke matchlesse lines, by A.H. of Tr. Colledge in Cambridge
monogr.author: I. D., preacher of Gods word

div.p: TO ALL YOV, The Israel of God, that be at London, Cambridge, or elsewhere, beloued of God, called to be Saints: Grace bee with you and Peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ, (Rom. 1.7.) with all that call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, in euery place, both their Lord and ours, (1 Cor. 1.2.)
